<<<api>>>: Activity.findViewById
<<<code>>>: drawer.setDrawerListener(new DrawerLayout.SimpleDrawerListener() {
    @Override
    public void onDrawerClosed(View drawerView) {
        super.onDrawerClosed(drawerView);
        FragmentTransaction tx = getSupportFragmentManager().beginTransaction();
        tx.replace(R.id.mainContent, Fragment.instantiate(MainActivity.this, "com.example.utilities.ContentPage", bData));
        tx.commit();
        getSupportActionBar().show();
    }

    @Override
    public void onDrawerOpened(View drawerView) {
        super.onDrawerOpened(drawerView);
        getSupportActionBar().hide();
    }
});
<<<explanation>>>: To achieve the desired effect, you can use the onDrawerClosed() and onDrawerOpened() methods of the DrawerLayout.SimpleDrawerListener. In the onDrawerClosed() method, you can replace the current fragment with the desired content and show the action bar. In the onDrawerOpened() method, you can hide the action bar.
